intro: Navia pungens, commonly known as the spiny navia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. Navia pungens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
